segment.source: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard (Windows 10)
segment.target: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes steps to run the wizard to create AppLocker rules on a reference device.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes steps to run the wizard to create AppLocker rules on a reference device.

segment.source: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard
segment.target: Run the Automatically Generate Rules wizard

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes steps to run the wizard to create AppLocker rules on a reference device.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes steps to run the wizard to create AppLocker rules on a reference device.

segment.source: AppLocker allows you to automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.
segment.target: AppLocker allows you to automatically generate rules for all files within a folder.

segment.source: It will scan the specified folder and create the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.
segment.target: It will scan the specified folder and create the condition types that you choose for each file in that folder.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local device or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local device or in a security template.

segment.source: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: To automatically generate rules
segment.target: To automatically generate rules

segment.source: Open the AppLocker console.
segment.target: Open the AppLocker console.

segment.source: Right-click the appropriate rule type for which you want to automatically generate rules.
segment.target: Right-click the appropriate rule type for which you want to automatically generate rules.

segment.source: You can automatically generate rules for executable, Windows Installer, script and packaged app rules.
segment.target: You can automatically generate rules for executable, Windows Installer, script and packaged app rules.

segment.source: Click Automatically Generate Rules.
segment.target: Click Automatically Generate Rules.

segment.source: On the Folder and Permissions page, click Browse to choose the folder to be analyzed.
segment.target: On the Folder and Permissions page, click Browse to choose the folder to be analyzed.

segment.source: By default, this is the Program Files folder.
segment.target: By default, this is the Program Files folder.

segment.source: Click Select to choose the security group in which the default rules should be applied.
segment.target: Click Select to choose the security group in which the default rules should be applied.

segment.source: By default, this is the Everyone group.
segment.target: By default, this is the Everyone group.

segment.source: The wizard provides a name in the Name to identify this set of rules box based on the name of the folder that you have selected.
segment.target: The wizard provides a name in the Name to identify this set of rules box based on the name of the folder that you have selected.

segment.source: Accept the provided name or type a different name, and then click Next.
segment.target: Accept the provided name or type a different name, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Rule Preferences page, choose the conditions that you want the wizard to use while creating rules, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Rule Preferences page, choose the conditions that you want the wizard to use while creating rules, and then click Next.

segment.source: For more info about rule conditions, see Understanding AppLocker rule condition types.
segment.target: For more info about rule conditions, see Understanding AppLocker rule condition types.

segment.source: Note: The Reduce the number of rules created by grouping similar files check box is selected by default.
segment.target: Note: The Reduce the number of rules created by grouping similar files check box is selected by default.

segment.source: This helps you organize AppLocker rules and reduce the number of rules that you create by performing the following operations for the rule condition that you select:
segment.target: This helps you organize AppLocker rules and reduce the number of rules that you create by performing the following operations for the rule condition that you select:

segment.source: One publisher condition is created for all files that have the same publisher and product name.
segment.target: One publisher condition is created for all files that have the same publisher and product name.

segment.source: One path condition is created for the folder that you select.
segment.target: One path condition is created for the folder that you select.

segment.source: For example, if you select C:Program FilesProgramName and the files in that folder are not signed, the wizard creates a rule for %programfiles%ProgramName.
segment.target: For example, if you select C:Program FilesProgramName and the files in that folder are not signed, the wizard creates a rule for %programfiles%ProgramName.

segment.source: One file hash condition is created that contains all of the file hashes.
segment.target: One file hash condition is created that contains all of the file hashes.

segment.source: When rule grouping is disabled, the wizard creates a file hash rule for each file.
segment.target: When rule grouping is disabled, the wizard creates a file hash rule for each file.

segment.source: Review the files that were analyzed and the rules that will be automatically created.
segment.target: Review the files that were analyzed and the rules that will be automatically created.

segment.source: To make changes, click Previous to return to the page where you can change your selections.
segment.target: To make changes, click Previous to return to the page where you can change your selections.

segment.source: After reviewing the rules, click Create.
segment.target: After reviewing the rules, click Create.

segment.source: Note: If you are running the wizard to create your first rules for a GPO, you will be prompted to create the default rules, which allow critical system files to run, after completing the wizard.
segment.target: Note: If you are running the wizard to create your first rules for a GPO, you will be prompted to create the default rules, which allow critical system files to run, after completing the wizard.

segment.source: You may edit the default rules at any time.
segment.target: You may edit the default rules at any time.

segment.source: If your organization has decided to edit the default rules or create custom rules to allow the Windows system files to run, ensure that you delete the default rules after replacing them with your custom rules.
segment.target: If your organization has decided to edit the default rules or create custom rules to allow the Windows system files to run, ensure that you delete the default rules after replacing them with your custom rules.
